SENT.plain: Through 17 years ten patients were treated for psychologically unacceptable tallness by bilateral femoral shortening
All were young adults between 17 and 28 years; one was acromegalic, one had Marfans syndrome and the other were tall for unknown reasons
The amount of shortening obtained was between 6 and 16 cm
One patient was reoperated bilaterally because of insufficient stability of the pin and plate fixation
All patients healed without significant complications

For exclusive cases, which have been carefully observed over several months, bilateral shortening seems to be a safe procedure either with midshaft shortening and KÃ¼ntscher nailing or subtrochanteric femoral shortening with pin and plate fixation
At review all patients were satisfied with their decision to be surgically shortened
Similar cases seem not to have been published
